com.team254.lib.util.motion

Class MotionProfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team254.lib.util.motion.MotionProfile

  • public class MotionProfile
extends java.lang.Object
    A motion profile specifies a 1D time-parameterized trajectory. The trajectory is composed of successively coincident MotionSegments from which the desired state of motion at any given distance or time can be calculated.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<MotionSegment> mSegments 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MotionProfile()
      Create an empty MotionProfile.

      Create a MotionProfile from an existing list of segments (note that validity is not checked).

    • Field Detail

      • mSegments

        protected java.util.List<MotionSegment> mSegments

    • Constructor Detail

      • MotionProfile

        public MotionProfile()
        Create an empty MotionProfile.

      • MotionProfile

        public MotionProfile(java.util.List<MotionSegment> segments)
        Create a MotionProfile from an existing list of segments (note that validity is not checked).
        Parameters:
        segments - The new segments of the profile.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if the given MotionProfile is valid. This checks that:

        1. All segments are valid.

        2. Successive segments are C1 continuous in position and C0 continuous in velocity.

        Returns:
        True if the MotionProfile is valid.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Check if the profile is empty.
        Returns:
        True if there are no segments.

      • stateByTime

        public java.util.Optional<MotionState> stateByTime(double t)
        Get the interpolated MotionState at any given time.
        Parameters:
        t - The time to query.
        Returns:
        Empty if the time is outside the time bounds of the profile, or the resulting MotionState otherwise.

      • stateByTimeClamped

        public MotionState stateByTimeClamped(double t)
        Get the interpolated MotionState at any given time, clamping to the endpoints if time is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        t - The time to query.
        Returns:
        The MotionState at time t, or closest to it if t is outside the profile.

      • firstStateByPos

        public java.util.Optional<MotionState> firstStateByPos(double pos)
        Get the interpolated MotionState by distance (the "pos()" field of MotionState). Note that since a profile may reverse, this method only returns the *first* instance of this position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position to query.
        Returns:
        Empty if the profile never crosses pos or if the profile is invalid, or the resulting MotionState otherwise.

      • trimBeforeTime

        public void trimBeforeTime(double t)
        Remove all parts of the profile prior to the query time. This eliminates whole segments and also shortens any segments containing t.
        Parameters:
        t - The query time.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all segments.

      • reset

        public void reset(MotionState initial_state)
        Remove all segments and initialize to the desired state (actually a segment of length 0 that starts and ends at initial_state).
        Parameters:
        initial_state - The MotionState to initialize to.

      • consolidate

        public void consolidate()
        Remove redundant segments (segments whose start and end states are coincident).

      • appendControl

        public void appendControl(double acc,
                          double dt)
        Add to the profile by applying an acceleration control for a given time. This is appended to the previous last state.
        Parameters:
        acc - The acceleration to apply.
        dt - The period of time to apply the given acceleration.

      • appendSegment

        public void appendSegment(MotionSegment segment)
        Add to the profile by inserting a new segment. No validity checking is done.
        Parameters:
        segment - The segment to add.

      • appendProfile

        public void appendProfile(MotionProfile profile)
        Add to the profile by inserting a new profile after the final state. No validity checking is done.
        Parameters:
        profile - The profile to add.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        The number of segments.

      • segments

        public java.util.List<MotionSegment> segments()
        Returns:
        The list of segments.

      • startState

        public MotionState startState()
        Returns:
        The first state in the profile (or kInvalidState if empty).

      • startTime

        public double startTime()
        Returns:
        The time of the first state in the profile (or NaN if empty).

      • startPos

        public double startPos()
        Returns:
        The pos of the first state in the profile (or NaN if empty).

      • endState

        public MotionState endState()
        Returns:
        The last state in the profile (or kInvalidState if empty).

      • endTime

        public double endTime()
        Returns:
        The time of the last state in the profile (or NaN if empty).

      • endPos

        public double endPos()
        Returns:
        The pos of the last state in the profile (or NaN if empty).

      • duration

        public double duration()
        Returns:
        The duration of the entire profile.

      • length

        public double length()
        Returns:
        The total distance covered by the profile. Note that distance is the sum of absolute distances of all segments, so a reversing profile will count the distance covered in each direction.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
